step.context: \text{Which of the following definitions of }\left|x+5\right|\\ \text{is correct?}
step.reason: \left|x+5\right| = -\left(x-5\right)\text{ when }x-5 \lt 0\implies x\lt5\\ \begin{align} \text{Similarly }\left|x-5\right| =\left(x-5\right)\text{ when }&x-5\geq 0\\ &\implies x\geq 5 \end{align}\\ \text{Hence, the interval }\left[2,8\right]\text{is broken in two at}\\ x=5

step.context: \text{Has the integral }A = \int_{2}^{8} \left|x-5\right|dx \text{ been}\\ \text{re - written correctly below?}\\
step.reason:
f \left(x\right) = \left|x-5\right| \text{ is computed differently in}\\ [2,5) \text{ and }[5,8]\\ \begin{align} \text{So, }A &= \int_{2}^{8}f \left(x\right).dx\\ &=\int_{2}^{5}f_1 \left(x\right).dx + \int_{5}^{8}f_2 \left(x\right).dx\\ \end{align}\\
\text{Where }f_1 \left(x\right) = -\left(x-5\right)\text{ and }f_2 \left(x\right) = \left(x-5\right)
